Award.AwardTitle: Technician Education in Additive Manufacturing and Materials (TEAMM)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
The manufacturing industry has progressed beyond traditional subtractive processes. Additive manufacturing (AM) technologies are emerging as key enabling practices for modern design and end product development and are revolutionizing the manufacturing process. The advancement of 3D printing or AM, in both consumer and commercial markets, is highly dependent upon innovations that improve printer capabilities, speed, and materials. As new materials are developed and 3D printers are increasingly capable of utilizing multiple materials, it is imperative that technicians understand these materials' properties both individually and as they are combined during the AM process. To address this gap in the convergence of additive manufacturing and materials, the Technician Education in Additive Manufacturing and Materials (TEAMM) project will forge a new collaborative network of public and private sector stakeholders to address the identification and adaption of skills standards to keep pace with advances in research and development.

TEAMM will serve as a catalyst to engage an international network of stakeholders to ensure that technician education meets industry standards and needs. TEAMM will improve access to instructional tools and curriculum modules that keep pace with the rapid rate of innovation and industry adoption of new and existing materials in the additive manufacturing and materials processes. Through social networking, TEAMM will improve education and establish network communications, collaboration and dissemination in a sustainable manner. TEAMM will support the education and development of new subject matter experts through professional development and access to network collaborators. The network will enable subject matter experts to customize instructional tools and resources to directly respond to and support the advancement of regional economies, further advancing this technology through a skilled and educated technician workforce.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Project Outcomes Report 

Technician Education in Additive Manufacturing and Materials (TEAMM), DUE 1501251, is a national/international network of stakeholders helping ensure technician education meets industry standards and needs. TEAMM successfully created and sustained a Coordination Network (CN) supporting the convergence of materials science and additive manufacturing over its life (07/01/2015-06/30/2021). Drivers behind the AM industry’s growth range from users, manufacturers, industry, inventors, entrepreneurs, innovators, associations, education, and government. AM leadership in the US is fragmented, usually due to rapid change, new uses of materials and different combinations of materials, and industry competition. This fragmentation often results in silos and knowledge gaps in various critical areas. TEAMM has collaborated with network members towards addressing and filling critical gaps. Through rich content, coordination, events, social media, and networking, TEAMM impacts education and communities positively and sustainably. TEAMM improves access to instructional resources/tools and curriculum modules that keep pace with the rapid rate of innovation and industry adoption of new and existing materials in AM, new standards and core competencies, and other materials processes. TEAMM stakeholders bring their own established networks that work to support the CN. TEAMM unites and connects these multiple networks around materials as common ground. TEAMM’s CN model is replicable and adaptable by other ATE Centers and projects across disciplines and industry sectors served.

Intellectual Merits

As the first NSF ATE Coordination Network awarded, TEAMM has innovated with strategic partners across industry, education, and professional associations. TEAMM is an exemplary model CN with vibrant leadership, memberships, and activities related to AM, materials science, and advanced manufacturing as well as other overlapping technologies, disciplines, and networks. TEAMM has provided AM related workshops, webinars, panels, resources, and modules for educators. TEAMM has contributed to the knowledge base and the development of an effective process for capturing the latest standards and translating them into core competencies for immediate use by educators. TEAMM has also established an innovative model of concurrent work with standards organizations -- a forward-looking “how to” approach for successful application of emerging standards from industry. PI Cossette has long participated in an international joint working group of ISO/ASTM focused on AM technician education and training. Beyond AM initiatives, TEAMM has contributed to a broad range of Maker Minded initiatives; CyberAcoustics initiatives; Nanotechnology initiatives; and Lightweight Manufacturing initiatives.

 

Broad Impacts

TEAMM has helped educate and prepare AM students and graduates to be successful in AM technician roles in the US workforce. AM technology, including medical applications, requires qualified technicians to build, repair, and test AM equipment demonstrating awareness and understanding of testing protocols, safety, materials usage and environmental issues. TEAMM helped pioneer and lead the convergence of additive manufacturing and materials, and broadly benefitted the advanced manufacturing industry and technician workforce in the United States. AM knowledge and skills continue to be in high demand at the technician level. As AM continues to expand, the technician workforce must remain current and have access to cutting-edge education and training programs that integrate materials science as a core competency of the AM discipline. TEAMM has helped advance AM and contributed to the body of knowledge in AM with its CN members and their networks and communities nationwide. As materials, processes, and manufacturing technologies and environments continue to emerge and evolve, AM has fundamentally changed and will continue to change design through production in advanced manufacturing industries.

 


Last Modified: 06/28/2021
Modified by: Imelda E Cossette
